text: (light electronic music)

- Hi, I'm Sounil Yu, creator
of the Cyber Defense Matrix.
It's vital to do whatever you can

to secure a software
code as it's being built.
But it's hard to do this perfectly,

so it's important to
incorporate runtime defenses

for web applications and edge
components, such as APIs.
You can get runtime defense

through web application
firewalls, or WAFs,
and API protection solutions.
There are several web application firewall
and API protection third party solutions
available through AWS Marketplace,
offering various deployment models

that enable you to intercept
inbound web or API traffic
to look for unauthorized activity

that might compromise
applications and data.

These solutions can provide
out-of-the-box capabilities
to protect your websites and APIs
against the OOSP top 10 threats,

layer 7 distributed
denial-of-service incidents,
bot traffic and more.

WAF and edge security
vendors in AWS Marketplace
also offer automated learning capabilities

that dynamically profile your
web applications and APIs
to generate custom roles
that are specific to your applications,
helping for more sophisticated events
that could affect security,
affect application availability,

or result in excessive
resource consumption.
These solutions can increase the security
of your web applications and APIs
and provide reporting capabilities
to illuminate unusual traffic patterns

and help you make more
informed security decisions.
